TEXT.TEXTVALUE: notext
Point the mouse to each requirement of the experiment to know the name / Click the "Continue" button to start the experiment.
An RB with a pellet is fixed in a stand with hotplate, stirrer and water bath. Switch on the stirrer.
Weigh out 500mg of Isatin in a weighing balance.
Isatin is added to the RB.
Isatin is added to the RB.
The mouth of the RB is closed with a guard tube filled with Calcium Chloride.
214mg of Calcium Hydride is added to the RB flask.
214mg of Calcium Hydride is added to the RB flask.
Isatin and Calcium Hydride are taken in a two-necked RB and the mouth of the RB is closed with a guard tube filled with Calcium Chloride.
10mL of dry DMF is added through a Solvent Syringe.
The RB is placed in the water bath.
Temperature of the water bath is set to 40-50° C. The system is allowed to stir for 30 minutes.
0.44mL of Allyl bromide is added to the system carefully.
Temperature of the water bath is set to 40-50° C. The system is allowed to stir for 4 to 5 hours.
The reaction mixture is taken out of the water bath.
After removing the pellet, the whole reaction mixture is transferred to a beaker containing Brine solution.
Then the solution is poured into a seperating funnel.
50mL of Ethyl acetate is added.
The seperating funnel is swirled for a few minutes.
The seperating funnel is swirled for a few minutes.
Replace the funnel in the stand.
Then the lower aqueous layer is transferred into a clean conical flask.
The coloured organic layer is collected into another conical flask. Using Ethyl acetate, the same procedure is repeated with the aqueous layer.
The coloured organic layer is collected into another conical flask. Using Ethyl acetate, the same procedure is repeated with the aqueous layer.
Sodium sulphate is added to the whole organic layer and the conical flask is swirled slowly to remove fine traces of water.
The collected organic layer is poured into an RB through funnel with cotton.
TLC is done with reaction mixture and Isatin solution.
TLC is done with reaction mixture and Isatin solution.
TLC is done with reaction mixture and Isatin solution.
The spotted TLC plate is kept in 15% Ethal Acetate-Hexane chamber.
The spotted TLC plate is kept in 15% Ethal Acetate-Hexane chamber.
TLC plate is dried and then kept inside an iodine chamber.
The colored spots will appear on the TLC plate at different levels.
The solvent from the reaction mixture is removed using a Rotary Evaporator.
RB flask is removed from the rotary evaporator.
The residue is packed into a silica column.
The product is eluted with 15% Ethyl Acetate-Hexane and collected in a clean conical flask.
The solvent is removed using Rotary Evaporator. Thus, the pure Allyl Isatin is obtained which can be characterised by spectroscopic analysis and melting point determination.
